title: Bombay Beach
author: Unknown
pages:
BOMBAY BEACH
SALTON SEA
Bombay Beach was an
active resort
community during the
60s and 70s. Now, it is
nearly abandoned.
The town lies on the
edge of the Salton
Sea in Southern
California, north of
Niland.

The city's beach is
mainly composed of
pulverized fishbones,
and most of the homes
in town are
abandoned. Recently,
the city has become a
hotspot for artists
and outcasts.
